result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Concurrent with: concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. Credit for 157 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with the victims.
No use of illegal drugs.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
Take any and all prescribed medications.
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharmika Renee Hickles

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (23 pages) commencing 06/04/2015 PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit for 157 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Take any and all prescribed medications.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* No use of illegal drugs.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached Restitution Worksheet.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Defense withdrew the NGI plea today.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 06-04-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.
Defendant picked up new charges.
Case adjourned to 04-28-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

INVOICE #
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $562.50 to Dr. Collins for services on 1/20/15, 2/4/2015, 2/13/2015. Copy in file.
COPY IN FILE.

Atty. Jeffrey Schwarz appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant, Sharmika Hickles, does NOT appear; currently in custody.  ADA Sarah McNutt appeared on behalf of the State.

Atty. Jeffrey Schwarz is now the attorney of record.
Defense requests a Projected Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 03-27-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.
Clerk CANCELLED the 02-26-2015 at 1:30 PM Status Conference date before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a return on doctor's report hearing.
Defendant requests a new attorney.
Atty. Devitt moves to withdraw.
No objections.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Devitt to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
**Atty. Anne Devitt is now discharged.
Case adjourned to 02-26-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
NGI Report as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Deborah Collins; filed.
for Examination Under Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty.

Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of his client. Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit as to the special plea. Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.

Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return at 02-19-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Atty. Anne Devitt called the clerk to reschedule the 01-13-2015 at 8:30 AM Arraignment Hearing.  Case adjourned to 01-14-2015 at 8:30 AM for Adjourned Arraignment Hearing.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
